Legal_Issue: Whether the Kishun family qualifies as Convention refugees or persons in need of international protection under Canadian law
Application_Facts: The Kishun family fled Guyana due to perceived ethnic targeting and threats; credible evidence of threats was presented, but violence affects all ethnic groups in Guyana
Decision_Outcome: The Kishuns do not qualify as refugees or persons needing protection
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the IRB's decision
Court_Ruling: The court dismissed the judicial review application
Grounds_for_Claim: Perceived ethnic targeting of Indo-Guyanese, threats to safety
Legal_Standard: Lack of state protection against persecution or significant risk to life
Assessment_Factor: Existence of state protection, government efforts to combat crime, generalized violence
Applicable_Legislation: Sections 96 and 97(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review following an unsuccessful refugee claim
Credibility_Assessment: Credible evidence of threats was found
Evidence_Used: Threats against the family, country condition reports on Guyana
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution based on ethnicity
Evidence_Assessed: Threats, state response to crime, ethnic dynamics in Guyana
Relief_Sought: Recognition as Convention refugees or protected persons, successful judicial review
Governing_Rule: Under sections 96 and 97(1), claimants must show lack of state protection against persecution
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to demonstrate absence of state protection
Decisional_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB), Federal Court
Harm_Assessment: Generalized violence in Guyana, not specific to Indo-Guyanese
Cause_Description: Kishun family fled Guyana due to perceived ethnic targeting and threats
Evidence_Handling: Credible threats acknowledged, but contextualized within broader societal violence
Legal_Provision: Section 96, Section 97(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: Threats deemed real but insufficient without proof of state inability to protect
Decision_Rationale: Guyana provides adequate protection; violence is widespread and not ethnically targeted
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard applied to IRB decision
